programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: The team sets out to forge two iconic weapons from action-adventure stealth video Assassin's Creed - the Scimitar and the mysterious Hidden Blade.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three executive chefs compete in this barbecue competition, showing their skills with the grill over three rounds.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick auctions off some of the shop's coolest finds, while back in Vegas, Corey and Chum go off-road to check out an Ultra 4 Racecar.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: One of the hunters suffers a gruesome injury, while a deckhand persuades his captain to change hunting grounds - a decision that pays off beyond their expectations.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: In Alberta, Adam and Brandon face off in a clash that will change the course of the winter season. Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the price of a rare mandolin, a 1950s woodworking machine and the business card of a famous outlaw.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered puppets from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show and a yearbook containing a letter bearing the signature of one-time US president Ronald Reagan.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a decision on impulse that threatens to backfire, and later gives a big loan to a customer with a dubious sob story.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether aliens could be causing natural disasters and wars in a bid to control the fate of the human race.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The story of a remote Brazilian island that locals claim was visited nightly for two months in 1977 by flying objects, leaving people with bizarre puncture marks and blood loss.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: Martin Bayerle attempts to prove the existence of the sunken treasure by hitting the books and following a historic Russian money trail.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys snap to attention when a client brings in a rare West Point musket. They also get offered pilot licences signed by father of flight Orville Wright.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items appraised include an antique electrotherapy kit, a 19th-century revolving cannon, a jukebox from 1973 and a 50-year-old electric waffle iron.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a piece of marble from Abraham Lincoln's tomb, an African sword and an antique Charlie Chaplin doll, but are not sure if the sellers are trustworthy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and the Old Man examine a pipe belonging to President Ulysses S Grant and a shoe from the famous racehorse Secretariat.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod has trouble letting go of the reins after he and Brandi agree to let Alex and Bozek handle the auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit Torrance for tough competition over only a few quality lockers. Brandi is forced to face her fears when Jarrod gets a locker sure to give her nightmares. Ivy has rarely scored in the area, so he tries a new tactic to change things up. Rene welcomes a pair of new buyers with some not so friendly competition.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three executive chefs compete in this barbecue competition, showing their skills with the grill over three rounds.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: When a diver gets tangled in the wreck and another line compromises the propeller, Tim suits up and dives into harm's way, but Martin quarrels over the location of the gold chamber.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigation into a possible alien visitation to England in December 1980, when Air Force personnel claimed they saw strange lights hovering in the sky.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining why different cultures have similar tales of monsters and giants, and questioning whether they could be genuine eye-witness accounts of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The hundreds of gigantic lines, some in the shape of animals, geometric patterns and even an alien-like being, that extend for several miles throughout a remote Peruvian desert. Known as the Nazca Lines, some theorists believe the markings have an extraterrestrial connection, and that the ancient people of the region possibly created these figures in tribute to the gods who visited them.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The FV-Tuna.com boat remains in the lead but on the Lisa & Jake, Paul has caught three fish and is on target to reach his $50,000 goal.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: That's the Way the Chicharron Crumbles
programme.desc: Culinary competition, and while signature dish round showcases some barbecue heavyweights. the crossfire and feast of fire rounds serve up some nostalgic classics.

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: It's Ozzy's birthday so Jack pulls a lot of strings to plan the perfect surprise trip for his father.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A vampire alligator terrorises Troy's hunting grounds, while RJ hunts with his brother Al for the first time since they were teenagers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Huntingdon Beach, Mary engages Rene in a challenge with more than money on the line. Meanwhile, Darrell teaches Brandon a tough lesson.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell puts a plan in motion to net himself a big win. Meanwhile, Ivy changes strategy and focuses on obtaining collectible items.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy actress and writer Diane Morgan and Countdown host Nick Hewer joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Impressionist and actor Alistair McGowan, former Dragons' Den businesswoman Hilary Devey and singer Josh Groban compete to have their pet hates banished, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include supermarkets, the smoking ban, Valentine's Day and people who treat animals like humans.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Holly Walsh and Nikki Bedi join regular panellist Alan Davies, as host Sandi Toksvig finally gets round to a bit of procrastination. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has found the magical amulet that can potentially send him home - but it doesn't work. Howell tricks him into getting a book from the oddly menacing Munty Library.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz discuss some of the most unusual collectors featured on the show.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are pitted against the Taylors in San Pedro, where they bid on shipping containers worth a fortune.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Former boxer Brandon Bernier and his wife Lori are anxious to see what is inside a locked coffin, but a rival thwarts their plans.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike bids for a 1940s motorcycle, while Danielle gets excited over a gun appraisal.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill, as it arrives in Paris.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Auckland, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness travel to Ethiopia, where they test cars to see how they can endure in the searing heat. Back at the track, Chris puts the Ferrari 488 Pista and McLaren 600LT through their paces.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis test their general knowledge in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, with a winner declared each Friday.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Robert Webb, Terry Wogan, Katy Wix and Kevin Bridges on the panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including bombs, bats and bagpipes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness present an electric cars special, each taking up the challenge of constructing a battery-powered sports car on a budget. Plus, Chris takes the Tesla Model 3 for a spin on the test track. Plus, Danny Boyle and Himesh Patel, director and star of fantasy comedy Yesterday, drop into the studio.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters and the Stig enter a 24-hour endurance race at Silverstone, which proves to be one of their toughest challenges to date. Plus, James May races against BMX bikers around Budapest in a Fiat 500 and Jeremy Clarkson test-drives the Ascari A10. Actor Keith Allen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Beattie Edmondson, Amol Rajan, Gaby Roslin and Hugh Dennis test their general knowledge in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games, with a winner declared each Friday.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace, sports presenter Gabby Logan and comedienne Sarah Millican join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to banish their pet hates - which include people at cashpoints, barbecues, shop assistants, buffets and anti-social cats - to the infamous room.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry quizzes Alan Davies, Clive Anderson, Phill Jupitus and Rich Hall for more interesting answers on subjects including bombs, bats and bagpipes in the mind-boggling quiz show.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Cariad Lloyd and Paul Sinha join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig considers various phenomena. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson answer questions on the theme of espionage. Host Stephen Fry will be awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to a series of celebrity guests, as Tim Vine encounters a wet bra, Alice Levine barely attempts cricket and Russell Howard makes a convincing liger.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Computer games adverts, board games, crosswords and Sudoku books all come under the spotlight, while Dave's jigsaw habit is revealed, and Alan Sugar makes a puzzling appearance.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, as he is fed up with having to struggle doing the rounds with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey explains how writing a biography of his ancestor John, the first Duke of Marlborough, changed the way Winston Churchill was seen by the public and politicians, and so paved the way for his return to power. The first volume, published in 1933, reinforced the perception of him as a man past his time. But it was the second instalment, depicting John Churchill's march to the Danube and victory at Blenheim, which began to mark out Winston as the only leading politician who truly knew war.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates historical evidence of the story of Jesus, examining his execution and his relationship with Mary Magdalene.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How Second World War criminal Adolf Eichmann was tracked down to Buenos Aires, Argentina, in 1961.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A town in West Virginia that fell victim to the pace of change when steam trains became obsolete and an underground complex in Italy that had been abandoned for nearly 2,000 years.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit the Royal William Yard in Plymouth, where they are given the chance to cast their eyes over a number of potentially valuable items. On the waterfront, militaria expert Graham Lay has doubts about a pair of doorknobs thought to have belonged to Admiral Horatio Nelson. The team is impressed by a chess set made from parts of the aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal, and a psychedelic painting of a band that performed at Woodstock intrigues Clive Stewart-Lockhart. Plus, jewellery specialist John Benjamin marvels at a diamond necklace the length of a skipping rope, donated to the city of Plymouth by Lady Astor.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The hunt for Gestapo head Klaus Barbie and death camp guard John Demjanjuk, dubbed 'The Butcher of Lyon' and 'Ivan the Terrible' respectively, which lasted into the 1980s.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A ruined compound on the edge of a peninsula in Colombia which was once home to a famous outlaw and the strange towers looming over red-tinted waters in a Portuguese landscape.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built
programme.desc: Tim Dunn follows his family's roots by exploring Metroland, the area around the Metropolitan Railway, and in Great Malvern learns about the woman behind a decorative 1860s station.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: The Mystical Boudoir of Nurse Gladys Emmanuel
programme.desc: Arkwright hatches a plan to get into Nurse Gladys's bedroom by forcing a reluctant Granville to masquerade as a burglar, so the miserly shopkeeper can come to her rescue. Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron star.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, as he is fed up with having to struggle doing the rounds with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie secretly buys a load of artificial fertiliser to help his supposedly organic crops - but is seen unloading it by a neighbour, who promptly phones the Agricultural Office to complain about his behaviour. Starring John Challis.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: The local mayor becomes embroiled in a sex scandal, so Boycie decides to stand for election as his replacement - unaware Llewellyn is planning to do the same. Marlene is put in a tight spot when a schoolfriend of Tyler's confesses he has developed feelings for her. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam investigates the suspicious death of elderly Jewish brothers Jake and Henry Davies, unearthing evidence of a racist connection. Starring Amanda Burton, Ahsen Bhatti and Andrew Sachs.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: Sequel to The White Queen, set in the Middle Ages and picking up as the tumultuous War of the Roses comes to an end, a new generation ascends to the throne in a tale of power, political clashes, family, love and betrayal. As the victor of the Battle of Bosworth, Henry Tudor, is set to ascend the throne and Elizabeth of York and her family, supporters of the former King, find themselves in grave danger. Lizzie must fulfil her promise to marry King Henry VII and bring peace to the nation. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII sets out to establish himself as the new sovereign, but finds a dangerous, deeply divided kingdom. Lizzie's loyalties are further complicated by the child she is expecting. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The regiment's tour in Germany is cut short. Meanwhile, a prank in the Officer's Mess causes trouble for Tucker. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Transatlantic rivalry breaks out when the officers have to share a barracks with a platoon of American soldiers. Starring Jerome Flynn and Gary Love.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro returns to Sun Hill, where he resumes his role as Superintendent - and immediately asks Jo Masters to find out how the press obtained a photo of Lesley Palmer. Meanwhile, Smithy and Laura Bryant continue to investigate the real Gabriel Kent's identity - and try to fathom the true nature of his relationship with June Ackland.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Gina's condition deteriorates, prompting her to ask for Connie's help to ensure a dignified death, but finds her friend is unimpressed with her negative attitude. Matt investigates the tampered drugs, learning more medicines are affected than he had realised, and Ric undertakes a risky operation, despite the CEO's objection that the patient is dangerously overweight.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Remembrance Day proves eventful in Holby A&E, as Finlay deals with a patient who would prefer to forget the past, and Duffy doesn't need reminding it's her 40th birthday, an occasion complicated by her husband's imminent arrival on the ward. Charlie enjoys a final outing with his Canada-bound son, only for the day to turn into a nightmare. Medical drama, starring Cathy Shipton, Derek Thompson and Kwame Kwei-Armah.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat gets a surprise when her estranged son David turns up on her doorstep.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sanjay's trying to speak to Gita but she's still too upset about his affair. David Wicks is introducing himself round the square and aunt Nellie arrives at the Fowlers.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A bungled burglary leads to a gruesome task for the Blue Watch team, and Dutch firefighter Marianne joins the watch on exchange.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dr Jack Kerruish leaves Africa hoping to become a country GP, while Beth Glover and Will Preston are looking for a partner to join their Derbyshire practice. First episode of the rural medical drama, starring Kevin Whately, Amanda Burton and.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias Harding makes his presence felt in Skelthwaite by ruthlessly firing Alan from the factory, while Luke is rushed to hospital after a serious accident on the rugby field, and Beth has a chance to test her maternal instincts when she is asked to lead the children's Moon Catching Expedition. Starring Brian Capron, Keith Barron, Christian Cooke and Kerrie Taylor.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie discovers a medieval recipe for traditional liquor among some ancient scrolls and goes into full-scale production, building a distillery in his barn and buying up all the potatoes he can find. The business goes well, but his success attracts some unwelcome visitors - the Driscoll brothers. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Feet of Nora Batty
programme.desc: Wally is called upon to settle an argument between Compo and Foggy - the exact size of Nora Batty's feet. Bill Owen, Kathy Staff and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The discovery of an abandoned mattress leads Foggy to embark on an town-wide clean-up campaign. Brian Glover guest stars in the rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A black man is murdered in a jail cell by a confirmed racist - a crime the prison service blames on overcrowding. However, the judge's probing reveals the institution wasn't operating at full capacity. A drink-driving appeal puts the bench at loggerheads, and Jo distances herself from her former lover. With Donald Sinden and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A photo featuring a missing 19-year-old music student turns up in a charity shop donation bag on the anniversary of her disappearance 17 years earlier, prompting Sandra to suspect the work of a serial killer. However, as the team gets to work identifying and tracking down the other people in the picture, increasing pressure to hand over the investigation forces Sandra to consider her future, and she turns to a familiar face to help her make her decision. Amanda Redman stars, with Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan is assigned to investigate the case of two murdered teenage girls whose frozen bodies have been uncovered by an avalanche in Norway. Post-mortem results show they were strangled 15 years apart and as investigations proceed, suspicion falls on a friend of one victim's family. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Anthony Head.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1989 Liverpool v Arsenal Title Decider - ITV Football Classic

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The second week of the cookery gameshow continues as chef Rosemary Shrager takes over as guest judge. First, she challenges the contestants to show off their knife skills as they are tasked to slice carrots into thin strips or juliennes, with three contenders being sent home after this initial round. The remaining cooks are then challenged to prepare a squid in 10 minutes, before creating a dish of their own using the freshly prepared squid in the final round.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of tequila from cactus plants in Mexico, and how steam helps to power New York City.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China tackle one of their biggest challenges to date - renovating an Audi Quattro.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue with their Audi Quattro renovation project.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer plans to capitalise on 1980s nostalgia by restoring an original 1982 Toyota Supra, and Ant Anstead works to bring this 35-year-old car into the modern era.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: OCC starts a 1970s-themed build and PJD finishes a bike for Newmont Mining. Meanwhile, Paul Sr and Paul Jr agree to meet to try to resolve their differences.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The fighters, bombers and sub-hunters of the US Navy are discussed by the pilots and engineers who work with the aircraft.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe comes up against swarms of mosquitoes when he joins a team searching for leeches.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the Tesla Model S, revealing its inner workings and impressive exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew travels to the birthplace of the Superformance MKIII, and explores its exterior.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's hunt for a gang of serial killers who targeted police in Washington DC, claiming several victims before months of painstaking nationwide surveillance finally paid off.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Rhonda Daugherty vanished, detectives turned to the public for information. A tip led to surveillance footage from a hotel that uncovered a journey of deceit.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old Megan Sharpton, who was raped and murdered before her body was set alight in July 2012. The torment led to her mother committing suicide.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a man who opened fire at CIA headquarters with an AK-47 assault rifle was brought to book four and a half years later after a $2million reward was offered for his capture.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The investigators of the Houston SPCA look back on some of the most shocking cases of animal cruelty, from the thousands dealt with each year.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: The surgical team tries to help a porpoise that has been left blind by a cataract.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown operates on a dog with a large mass hanging from its back leg.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Natalie is hoping Kleinfeld's will be the last stop on her bridal gown tour, while Amy has lost five stone but still sees herself as overweight.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: With no budget for their wedding, George Kotsiopoulos attempts to glam up a wedding for Kayla and Cody in under five days.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown deals with Fergus, the accident-prone dog, and Brian, the bulldog who is struggling to breathe. Tim attempts to tackle some runaway sheep.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It's a first for Dr Chris Brown as he tests his skills against fast-moving turtles. A hungry pup is in danger of hurting itself after starting to eat things that it shouldn't.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A dead puppy is found chained up in an abandoned house, and a cat hoarder is encouraged to give up some pets.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Kent rescues a neglected puppy whose embedded collar has caused a festering wound. Plus, a troubled young woman steals a golden chow.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A look at the importance as evidence of blood, which can sometimes be the only means of identifying the killer in otherwise baffling murder cases.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of outgoing 23-year-old Brandi Wells, who vanished in Longview, Texas, shortly after heading for a nightclub in August 2006. Her car was later found abandoned on a major interstate.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. The car she was travelling in has never been recovered, though it was possibly spotted two weeks later in Camden, New Jersey.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: A case from May 1997, when eight-year-old Jamie Lavis was on the Manchester bus Darren Vickers was driving just prior to his disappeance. Vickers joined the hunt and spoke on television - but was hiding an awful truth. Bones from Jamie's torso were eventually found hidden in bushes on a golf course five months later, and evidence led detectives back to the driver.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having beaten cancer, Kristin is ready to marry her high-school sweetheart, while Latoya wants a ball gown with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant consultant and part-time model Ashely dreams of a gown she tried on at a different salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Candice is shopping with her mother, with three weeks to go until her wedding, while Jacy arrives at the salon with an entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: You're Sexy and You Know It
programme.desc: Belly-dancing paralegal Sahar has her fitting, while Aimee goes in search of a tight dress with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stella brings along an entourage ahead of her Greek wedding, while Carli arrives for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle shares the spotlight with her mother, Afrodite argues with her mum over fashion and Lindsey wants hers to attend the fitting.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three Brits head for a market in Arles, France, to pick up items to spruce up and sell at a profit in Clapham, with one buyer hoping rustic pitchforks will be a hit.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou's manoeuvring skills are put to the test as he drives a client's 40ft motorhome, and the Prestige Pawnbrokers boss also jets off to Marbella, Spain, with gem expert Kristen to value some precious jewellery. A self-confessed shopaholic hopes to sell two modern art paintings to pursue a new career in photography, while a woman decides to get rid of some of her designer handbags to raise cash for her hair extensions business.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Liz is bed-bound with severe lymphedema making it impossible to walk. Isolated and friendless, she has depression, and lives with her mother who is too ill to care for her.

programme.title: My 3000lb Family
programme.sub-title: The Kings: It's Life or Death
programme.desc: Amanda undergoes bariatric surgery in a bid to lose enough weight to treat her cancer. Meanwhile, Doctor Procter informs Casey he could die is he does not lose weight.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: Psychotherapist Linda Papadopoulos helps a man with excessive body hair, whose shyness about his condition is preventing him from having a normal social life and finding love.

programme.title: My Naked Secret
programme.desc: A woman who lost 150lbs undergoes two extensive surgeries to remove her huge amount of excess skin in the hope of rebuilding her confidence.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How the FBI flushed out a deadly sniper who targeted African-American men.
